definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

sentences.english: But drug companies have repeatedly been shown to bury unflattering data.
sentences.chinese: 然而製藥公司卻一再隱瞞那些對自己不利的數據。

sentences.english: The seer made no reply, and again and again Cao Cao pressed the question.
sentences.chinese: 先見沒有回答，並一再曹操施壓的問題。

sentences.english: Whoever ignorantly creates an attachment, that stupid person comes upon suffering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 無知的蠢人執着生存因素，一再蒙受痛苦。

sentences.english: Our Party warned time and again that leading cadres should follow the mass lines.
sentences.chinese: 我黨一再三令五申領導幹部要走羣衆路線。

sentences.english: My father also kept telling them to hide the cameras.
sentences.chinese: 因此，父親也一再告誡他們要把攝影機藏好。

sentences.english: Our feet slumped repeatedly through the melting ice。
sentences.chinese: 經過融化的冰時，我們的腳一再地陷了進去。

sentences.english: He chalked his billiard cue again and again.
sentences.chinese: 他一再用白堊粉擦他的球杆尖。

sentences.english: The savior is also recurrently crucified.
sentences.chinese: 救世主也總是一再受難。

sentences.english: Docile, it accepts the reiterated suggestion.
sentences.chinese: 馴服的公衆接受了這個一再被重申的啓事。

sentences.english: China has promised repeatedly to take tougher measures to curb piracy.
sentences.chinese: 中國已一再承諾，會採取更強硬的措施來遏止盜版。

sentences.english: Chinese officials have repeatedly emphasised the need for a stable exchange rate.
sentences.chinese: 中國官員一再強調需要保持匯率穩定。

sentences.english: He would again and again allege that he was wholly unfitted to new duties.
sentences.chinese: 他一再指出，他完全不適合擔任新的職務。

sentences.english: Accordingly, the issue of the orientation of business zone in the sub-center of city is frequently concerned.
sentences.chinese: 因此，商圈定位問題也一再被人們所關注。

sentences.english: For the last twenty years I have repeatedly emphasized the matter of spreading the Cause of God.
sentences.chinese: 二十年來，我一再強調傳播聖道之事宜。

sentences.english: The adverse weather conditions over the past few months have left Liverpool with a host of re-arranged fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月糟糕的天氣讓利物浦一再重新安排賽程。

sentences.english: So I do this drive, this three-hour drive, again and again to see the farmer.
sentences.chinese: 所以我一再的開三小時的車去見那個農場主。

definition: over and over again/again and again

pinyin: yi1 er2 zai4 , zai4 er2 san1

definition: to make a supreme effort/at all costs
many times/on more than one occasion
have no choice or option but to/cannot but/have to/can't help it/can't avoid
to be determined to/to insist on
to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
